text: OLIVER lying in bed. He gets up, looks in the mirror, takes down a dictionary from his shelf, looks up a word, ticks it off, puts on a record and opens the curtains.

Most people think of themselves as individuals. That there is no-one on the planet like them. This thought motivates them to get out of bed and eat and walk around like nothing’s wrong. My name is Oliver Tate. We cut outside and slowly zoom back to show the town in A which he lives. A caption: A Winter in Wales, a little while ago’. Note we also do this in static, non-zoomed shots.

STILL SHOTS throughout the town in which OLIVER TATE lives. Titles. We end on a shot of a school. INT. SCHOOL CLASS —- MORNING 2 We track down a school corridor, ending up at a classroom MR DAVEY, AN ENGLISH TEACHER, addresses the class (14/15) The camera follows a note passed between the pupils, ABBY SMUTS; CHIPS (cocky, smirking); MARK PRITCHARD and finall to JORDANA BEVAN (bored, casually flaming the underside o her desk with a lighter); OLIVER TATE watches her.

What kind of young person am I? That’s the challenge. We talk about challenges, don’t we? Well that’s the challenge I’m giving you this term. A gauntlet, so to speak. But this gauntlet is also an opportunity. An invitation, if you will, to self-discovery. What do I mean by self-discovery. Mark Pritchard. .?
Having a wank? MR.DAVEY CLICKS HIS FINGERS AND SENDS HIM OUT.
SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 1A.
Self-discovery. Who am I? What a question - let’s look at that...etc
I find that the only way to get through life is to picture myself in an entirely disconnected reality - I often imagine how people would react to my death:  SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 2.
Track in to tanoy.
Mr. Dunthorne’s quavering voice as he makes the announcement -
He was a gifted pupil, loved by all. It’s not only a loss to the school, it’s a loss to the Welsh nation.
We see what OLIVER describes.
- the shocked faces of my classmates -

head_text.subj: BEING COMFORTED BY HIS PE TEACHER, AN ATTRACTIVE WOMAN.

text: A a playground bedecked with A flowers -

B the empty stillness of a school B corridor - a young child trying to make sense of it all D Shot of a small child being comforted by a teacher. D Cc A REPORTER talks to a news camera in the playground. C Floral tributes behind her. We would need a prop camera and a cameraman.
local news analysis - WE see early school pictures of OLIVER, full screen, smil and full of life.. We see a newspaper with the caption ‘OLIVER TATE DEAD’
SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 2A.
So I suppose the question is, what now?
tear-streaked tributes - News footage of school children crying - VIDEO 8 Plate shot of TV to comp in footage.

The studied stoicism of my parents. We have a shot of LLOYD and JILL at a table with a plain background. Camera bulbs flash off - they are making a statement for camera. WE SHOW THIS ON A TV. NOTE - IS IT
candle-lit vigils  SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 3. Note: WE SEE A BEAUTIFUL WOMAN, CRYING AND CARRYING A PIC
WITH THE INSCRIPTION, IN ITALICS: ‘OLIVER TATE R.I.P. WE THE ANGELS’
- and, finally, my glorious resurrection

Six or so girls, including Abby and Jordana are draped over one another by a tree, crying. Blinking through the tears, they see something. It’s OLIVER. He’s slightly glowing, like Obi-Wan in STAR WARS. He has a serene look to him. The GIRLS look perplexed.
Don’t ask how. Just know that I am now more powerful than ever. The girls look back, in awe.

Let’s get off. We CUT BACK to the CLASSROOM. A OLIVER allows himself a small smile. He is staring at the back of JORDANA’S NECK. She looks round. OLIVER awkwardly looks away. MR. DAVEY is wrapping things up. MARK PRITCHARD passes OLIVER a note. He indicates that it’s from JORDANA. OLIVER opens it. It says, ‘If you’ve opened this note, you’re a cock-riding twat’. He tries to pass i to ZOE (15, OVERWEIGHT/STUDIOUS). She refuses it.

Play the game, get stuck in, and let’s make this term one to remember. OK. Let’s get down to business. Page 23 in your blue books. Oliver Tate you can come up and read out that note as it seems so interesting. OLIVER walks up. The class woofs.
What does it say? The bell goes. The class breaks up. MR DAVEY does some cr control.
Alright etc you’ve been saved this time etc.
SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 3A. Oliver looks at JORDANA slope out. MARK PRITCHARD puts hi arm around ABBY.
Establishers of children in the corridors. OLIVER is look at JORDANA. SLOW MOTION (in OLIVER'S head) she turns back looks at OLIVER, lovingly. We move into OLIVER.
OLIVER walks out of class, the corridor is nearly empty.
OLIVER spying on JORDANA. By the trees or bike sheds. JORDANA is sitting by herself burning things or smoking.  SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 4.
OLIVER'S QUEUING for lunch. CHIPS and KEIRON enters the frame. We establish GENE the dinner lady here.
You know Jordana Bevan’s back on the market?
You pushed.

You pushed! The word on the playground is - Prichard fingered Abby Smuts at the Blue Light Disco. Bevan found them in the toilets with Pritchard up to his knuckles. We see ABBY with PRITCHARD across the refectory.
So?
Thought you'd be interested. So you won’t mind if I have a go?
No - it’s fine. We’re just friends...etc OLIVER SHRUGS. JORDANA comes OVER
Hey, Jordana.
Do you want a picture?
Smooth, Ol.
Wasn't trying to be - so you haven’t got me.

OLIVER has found himself a secluded place. He watching CHIPS and KEIRON, start to tease ZOE, an OVERWEIGHT GIRL (15). But, mainly, he sees how JORDANA is laughing and delighting in the teasing.  SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 4A.
Lately, I’ve become interested in the theory of cognitive dissonance. We see an appropriate encyclopedia entry. A
This holds that contradictory- We TRACK into a TV - on it is a professor on an O.U.-TYPE TV show, he has an accent of some kind. Perhaps German  10 SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 5.

- contradictory thoughts or beliefs serve as a driving force that compel the human mind to acquire or invent new thoughts or beliefs so as to minimise the amount of dissonance between such cognitions or thoughts. We CUT TO a chart drawn by OLIVER. STICK MEN. Cc

It’s all about balance. While I essentially disapprove of bullying, I’m also cognisant of the value of appearing to fit in. And, further, my need to socially advance myself in school- We see this on a NEW CHART. A STICK FIGURE of OLIVER Cc separated from a group by a hurdle titled ‘WILLINGNESS TO BULLY’.

- conflicts with being able to show basic humanity to others. So I must invent a new thought. Perhaps Zoe’s so fat that she doesn’t have real feelings? This logic is backed up by further line drawings. We CUT to: CHIPS running off with ZOE’S BAG. WE SEE OLIVER DECID TO FOLLOW.

OLIVER is running with ZOE’S BAG. He lobs it over to JORDANA, who throws it to CHIPS. CHIPS does some good verbal taunts and ducks and dives. Note: we also do a version where we start with Chips. ZOE follows, lamely protesting.
Stop it. Please!
Chips is an outstanding bully. He once made our religious education teacher cry using only blu tack.

The RELIGIOUS EDUCATION TEACHER, MISS DUTTON, walks in. She has a distinctive mole on her chin. She looks up at the class. Everyone has blu tac moles on their chins. She starts to cry and runs out of the room.  11 SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 6.
What did I tell you? I fucking told you.
ZOE gathers her belongings up and clutches them to her chest.
That’s it, Fat, almost there. They reach a small stagnant pond. They form a circle roun and chuck the bag between them over the pond.
Give it back

She manages to grab the bag from OLIVER, there’s a scuffle, a shove, and she starts to fall. The image freezes as ZOE teeters on one leg, her hand outstretched towards the pencil case. We see close, froze shots of everyone.

I don’t know which one of us put a hand to Zoe’s back. For a moment I imagine that she might just balance there, a fat ballerina on one leg, but her foot slips from under her and she belly-flops into the shallow gloop. The image unfreezes and we see Zoe pushed into the shallo gloop. Her ruler, pens and pencils float on the thick algae. She writhes around and we close in on OLIVER'S FACE.

We all feel proud; as Zoe begins to sob, shirt splattered green, stationery slowly sinking, we know that this would be one of those vivid memories from youth that Mr Davey told us about in this morning’s lesson. The kids run away. OLIVER stays there frozen. He looks between the fleeing bullies and the victim, eyes wide, hi face scrolling through various emotions.  12 13 14 15 SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 7.
OLIVER helps ZOE out of the pond. SHE SHOVES him away wit her MUDDY HANDS.
OLIVER and ZOE walk along, far apart from one another. OLIVER is now also covered in mud. They've clearly fought
I was trying to stop you falling.
Leave me alone please. Then go fuck yourself.

In many ways I prefer my own company. It gives me time to think. We see OLIVER sitting in an unusual place, perhaps a tree reading. Also - in a bath tub by the industrial estate. Walking BA along, bouncing a tennis ball.

I suppose it’s a bit of an affectation, but I often read the dictionary. My word for today is flaigitious, which means ‘wickedly shameful’.. We see an insert. B Other times I'll go to the beach and stare at the sea as though I’m in a documentary about a prominent thinker who’s struggled with unspeakable loss. OLIVER STANDS ON THE WALL BY BARRY BEACH, LOOKING OUT. Cc He walks to the beach. He looks up at the sky.  SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 7A.

But recently I’ve been getting the feeling that I’m not quite here, as though there’s another Oliver Tate inside me, operating the levers of a life-sized Oliver- shaped shell. I’ve just turned fifteen but I have the fearful face of a forty year old.  16

SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 8. He looks back to the sea and watches the waves hitting hi outstretched feet. He doesn’t move, and allows the water to lap around him. EXT. STREET OUTSIDE OLIVER’S HOUSE- EVENING 16 OLIVER sees GRAHAM’S van.
OLIVER, SODDEN FEET, COVERED IN MUD, approaches his front door, takes a deep breath and walks in.
Oliver? What happened to you? We were waiting for you.
OLIVER is in the KITCHEN as his MOTHER, JILL (40), tries to get the mud off his SCHOOL UNIFORM with a stiff brush.
My mother is worried that I have mental problems. I found a book about teenage paranoid delusions during a routine search of my parents’ bedroom. We see a cutaway of OLIVER making this discovery. A
After that I started slipping certain choice phrases into our conversations.
We jump cut through OLIVER'S DIFFERENT responses. OLIVER tucked in , his mother perched on the end of the bed
My body has been replaced by a shell/ My internal organs are made of stone/ I have been dead for years.  18 SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 9.
A dinner party is in progress. OLIVER’S parents, LLOYD an JILL along with JILL’S WORK COLLEAGUE, JACKIE and her husband MALCOLM. JILL and LLOYD clear the table
It’s perfectly normal to have an active imagination at Oliver's age.
Thank you, Malcolm.
(to LLOYD) That trout was glorious by the way.
But where’s he got it from? Not from Lloyd. He doesn’t have an imaginative bone in his body.
Marine biology is pretty creative actually-
You research and categorise fish, Lloyd -
That’s one part of it - you know I was on Open University once -
Shall I show them the tape, Dad?
Stay at the table, please Ol. I said to Lloyd should we send him to a psychiatrist? But he said we couldn’t afford it.
I said it might not be worth the money at this point.
Cos Lloyd can get a little bit like that. Shut off. You know, like he’s not there
The invisible man!  SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 10.
If only! Good humoured dinner party laughter.
JILL is in a boring meeting.

My mum’s lucky because her mental health problems can be mistaken for charm and sociability. Perhaps her job’s to blame. She works for the council’s legal services department. One of the rules in her office is that, if it is your birthday, you are held responsible for bringing your own cake to work. We see a brief insert of JILL guiltily producing a cake a work.

location: LLOYD IN A ROW BOAT/INT. MUSEUM 20

text: My Dad divides his time between the museum and isolated lakes, finding fish that only he and maybe four other professors in the world would even know about. Adults are full of secrets. 21 INT. OLIVER’S HOUSE. HIS PARENT’S BEDROOM- DAY 21 We cut to a shot of LLOYD (40) lying in bed. He wears a TATTY, OLD DRESSING GOWN and is sipping from a mug.

For some time I wondered why dad would stay in bed for days at a time drinking endless amounts of hot lemon, using the same mug over and over and never washing it. But then, one day, I solved that mystery. A We cut to the BATHROOM. OLIVER sees a bottle of anti- A depressants. We see it’s made out to LLOYD TATE. He pours out some tablets into his hand. They’re BRIGHT BLUE.

head_text.subj: AA HE LOOKS UP THE NAME OF THE DRUG IN THE MEDICAL DICTIO

text: SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 11.
I keep the empty bottles in a box of my old toys. We see an INSERT of this. B

I’ve also learned that my parents have not had sex for seven months. WE CUT to OLIVER checking the dimmer switch in his parent bedroom. He walks back to his bedroom - he exchanges a quizzical look with JILL.

I’ve been monitoring their intimacy via the dimmer switch in their bedroom. I know when they've been at it because the next morning the dial will be set to half way. He writes his findings in his book. We see a graph with D ‘dimmer switch position’ on one axis and ‘likelihood of parents’ divorce’ on another.
I’ve seen their dry, pursed kisses grow ever more bloodless. We see a series of unaffectionate kisses between them. E
Peering through the crack of his door, OLIVER sees LLOYD walking down the stairs with some bedding.
OLIVER watches TV on a small, portable set. A father and son are talking on a rooftop.
It’s no wonder I’ve retreated into fantasy: I wish life could be more like American soap operas.
You can tell me anything, you know that, Dad.  24 SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 12.
Thanks son. You’re my best buddy. It’s been so tough since your mother died...
That wasn’t your fault.
I should never have taken the yacht out in that storm.. Sometimes I hate the sea so much.
You're going to make this restaurant work. I swear you will. You’re a great chef. And a great dad.
You’re such a great son. I can’t believe you're twelve already. My little baby’s a man. I love you so much. SUDDENLY, TV KID TWO APPEARS.
Dad! It’s Billy. He’s bleeding! He’s bleeding everywhere! FADE TO BLACK.
Then, whenever things got dramatic, you could just fade the picture down and pick things up again later.

OLIVER looks out the window. He sees a house opposite that has no curtains. It is A sparsely furnished. The walls are white and the furniture is either cream or covered in dust covers. Oliver can see A MAN performing various NINJA-LOOKING moves. This is GRAHAM (30s/40s). (Possibly in the garden) KIM-LIN, an attractive JAPANESE GIRL walks up behind him. She puts he hand on GRAHAM’S CHEST. They start to kiss passionately and fall to the floor, as if about to have sex. They disappear from Oliver’s view. Oliver’s shocked, half- repelled, half-intrigued.  25 26 27 SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 13.

We see LLOYD folding out the sofa bed. LLOYD lies down on it and stares up at the ceiling. INT. OLIVER'S HOUSE. HIS PARENT’S BEDROOM - NIGHT 26 JILL is emptying out a box onto the bed. She looks throug various photos of herself and LLOYD. We see a picture of her when she was young, with LONG HAIR, somewhere vaguely idyllic and sunny. There is also a line drawing of her, signed ‘Love, G.’ She then notices OLIVER watching her, walks to the door and closes it.
Goodnight, Oliver We FADE DOWN like a soap opera. CAPTION: PART ONE Cc
OLIVER is standing next to LLOYD, his FATHER. OLIVER look at the sofa in the living room. On it sits a pillow and a neatly folded duvet. LLOYD turns towards the door.
Tell your mother to hurry up. I‘1l wait in the road. OLIVER walks up the stairs and into his parents room. He hits the dimmer switch on the wall. The ceiling light comes on harshly.
You look nice.
I’m not ready.
You look good for a mum.
Yes. Well I’m younger than most mums.  28 SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 14.
Dad says to hurry up.
EXT/INT. OLIVER’S HOUSE - MORNING OLIVER runs downstairs

Mum's getting the bus! He opens the front door and sees LLOYD talking to the nex door neighbour, GRAHAM. GRAHAM is next to his YOUNG, 28 BEAUTIFUL JAPANESE GIRLFRIEND KIM-LIN. LLOYD is visibly t and keeps trying to half-get into his car. OLIVER watches surreptitiously. We focus on OLIVER’S REACTION to the following scene.
Well - terrific. Such a small world.
Yes - well it’s such a great area.
I love it
She just loves it.
Highest cancer rates in Europe!
Well, that’s what took my uncle.
I’m so sorry. It’s a lovely house.
Thank you. My uncle was gay, so I get to inherit it all. And this was Jill's grandmother’s house, right...
Yes.  SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 15.
Jill and I would spend hours up in that room. Listening to records, hatching plans.
Right. So are you going to sell up or...
I’m gonna let things take their own path.
That’s great. To have the time to do that.
I work to live, not live to work. So - I was saying to Jill we should all meet up -
Yes. Absolutely. That’d be lovely. We’ll consult and be in touch. Can’t wait. When did you see Jill?
Just in town. I think compatible energies are destined to keep interconnecting.
I agree.
Great. I’m sure you’re right.. Graham gives Lloyd a long man hug.
Give my love to Jill.
Will do. Great to see you. Great we're so close, now! In proximity. GRAHAM and KIM-LIN wander back down the road to a psychedelic VAN. GRAHAM trots back to LLoyd.
Hey - Lloyd. Sorry - did you hear me and Kim Lin having sex outside on the grass last night?  SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 15A.
No.

Well, if you do just let me know. She’s a lovely girl, but she’s a bit of a howler. He walks back to the van which has has a big picture of GRAHAM on the side saying ‘THE GRAHAM T. PURVIS SYSTEM: psychic and physical excellence’ amongst a STARBURST of ASTROLOGICAL signs. LLOYD, looking lonely, waves after them as they drive off. OLIVER approaches.
Mum's getting the bus.  29 SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 16.
Right. I’1l give you a lift to school then.
Can I do the gears?
Okay.
What did they want?
Dinner. Not on my watch though.
Why were you being so friendly, then?
You can’t let people like that know what you’re thinking.
What kind of people are they? LLOYD turns to OLIVER with purpose
Mystics. OLIVER nods understandingly.
LLOYD drives.
How’s school etc Any girls - there’s plenty of time for that nonsense etc Look: that’s the thing we saw yesterday etc
Third, please. And then into fifth. Save a bit of petrol. She's been thirsty recently. OLIVER puts the car into third gear and then into fourth There’s a pause.  SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 16A.
You can say what you like about Wales but you cannot beat it for scenery. We see OLIVER take in a beautiful vista. He looks at in the side mirror, reflected in the car.
I’m not sure I believe in scenery. Lloyd nods. The car stops. We see OLIVER get out.
Bye, Dad. They shake hands.  30
31 32 SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 17.
I‘’1l pick you up at five. Go get ‘em, killer. Oliver starts walking.
As usual, Dad drops me 800 yards from school. We see him approach his SCHOOL.
That way I can slip in unnoticed, like a torpedo. Oliver is charged by CHIPS and KERION. He does an undignified swerve in order to avoid them.
MR.DAVEY is taking the register. We see that ZOE isn’t there. OLIVER looks concerned.
Later - OLIVER looks for ZOE, but can’t find her.
OLIVER travels home, unsettled. JILL sits in the back.

head_text.subj: INT. OLIVER'S HOUSE. LIVING ROOM- EVENING

text: The TATES are watching television, we can’t see the programme.
I used to have long hair. Like her.
Hmm?
I used to have long hair. Remember? 30
31 32  SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 17A.
Yes.
She's pretty, isn’t she/
Er... I don’t know
Did you like it when I had long hair?
Er...
Or short like now?
I like your hair no matter how long it is.
But did you prefer it long?
Either way is good  33 SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 18.
No opinion?
It’s up to you.
So it wouldn’t bother you if I shaved it off?
Not if it made you happy.
If you want to shave off your hair, you should mum. Definitely.
Why would I shave my hair of Lloyd? She walks off.
What a stupid idea.
OLIVER takes out some paper from a drawer. He feeds it into a typewriter and starts to type.

Zoe Preece hasn’t been in school the past few days so I’ve written a pamphlet giving her a few pointers on how to break out of the victim cycle. We see close INSERTS of the following snippets: “Weirdly, you’re not that fat. You’re fat in the mind” “Maintain a facade of complete indifference.” “Transform any facet of your personality to fit in.” “You are who you pretend to be.” “If you must study, do so in private.” “Don’t cry to the dinner ladies.” Some are in italics, some are underlined, some are in capitals.

I've also given her two examples to inspire her. We cut to RHYDIAN BIRD. He is in the playground and has B pulled his pants down to fart. He is surrounded by clapping pupils chanting ‘Rhydian! Rhydian! including OLIVER, CHIPS and KEIRON. As many of our featured kids as possible.’  SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 19.

Firstly, Rhydian Bird. He once pulled his trousers down in the playground to fart and followed through, coiling a unhealthy turd onto the tarmac. But, instead of looking embarrassed, he screamed with laughter and pointed. Nobody can tease him about it because he is so proud. I remember watching him with renewed respect. We see OLIVER'S AWED REACTION. WE cut to CHIPS. OLIVER (V.O.) (CONT’D) c Secondly, Chips. He wasn’t even considered that hard until Keiron King famously stabbed him in the back with my compass. We see this. He said nothing, showed no discomfort as his shirt blossomed with blood poppies. His stoicism reminded me of the brave men who died in the first world war. Every year on that day I hold a minute’s silence in his honour. OLIVER gathers up several A4 pages, signs ‘Good luck! Bes wishes for a persecution-free future, Oliver Tate’ at the bottom, and puts them in a brown manila envelope. He then searches in his drawer for something. It’s a ‘50p off’ voucher for a Burger Chain. He pops it in.

I’m not quite sure that I’ve found my special skill yet. I’ve tried smoking a pipe; flipping coins; listening exclusively to French crooners; I even had a brief hat phase, but nothing stuck. WE SEE BRIEF INSERTS: OLIVER behind the bike sheds with a pipe; flipping a coin under a street lamp; E putting on a Serge Gainsbourg record; F wearing a cowboy hat at dinner with his parents. G
Maybe my mission in life is to help others. (MORE)
34 35 SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 20.

Like the Samaritans, but a version that specifically targets the obese. I need to find out who I am. Insert: Oliver’s notebook on his desk. Who am I? Investig He rips out the paper and pins it to the wall.
OLIVER is driven to school. OLIVER walks into school
OLIVER tentatively pads up to GENE, a dinner lady. He has put the collar up on his jacket, as if he’s in a Noir film.

The most secure route to Zoe is Big Gene who, over the last few months, had become her only friend and confidant. We see a brief shot of ZOE crying next to GENE, who's A comforting her. Gene told me that Zoe was very unhappy here and moved schools. I persuaded her to give Zoe the pamphlet by saying it was a love letter. OLIVER produces the now dog-eared A4 envelope from his rucksack. We CUT TO JORDANA, watching the scene from afar
That’s a big love letter.
I’ve got a big heart. Taxi driver gesture as he touches his heart, Betsy’s desk

Sometimes I wish there was a film crew following my every move. I imagine the camera craning up as I walk away. But, unless things improve, the biopic of my life will only have the budget for a zoom out.  SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 20A. OLIVER does a little twirl as he walks away. We Zoom out to over JORDANA’S SHOULDER. JORDANA REACTS.  36 SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 21.
OLIVER is dissecting a frog. His lab partner is JORDANA. She is holding a bit of the creature while OLIVER makes incisions with a scalpel.
I feel bad cutting into its head.
Why? it’s just a fucking frog.
It’s still a thing though. It had life.
I wonder where they get the frogs?
I don’t know. Probably a lake or river nearby. They probably have a guy who does it. I could find out. My dad’s in this area.
I don’t actually want to know.
Neither do I. I’m just saying I can find out. You asked.
I wonder where Fat is.
Zoe?
She hasn’t been in school for a while, has she?
Hasn't she? I hadn’t noticed. There’s an awkward pause.
I would’ve thought you would. She leaves quite a big gap.
She’s not really on my radar...
Do you think it’s because we pushed her into the pond?  SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 21A.
I didn’t push her.
Do you think she’s at home just weeping herself to death?
I didn’t push her.
Maybe you should write to her. Maybe you should maybe write her a pamphlet or something. What do you think?
What is this? What do you want?
Meet me under the railway bridge after school and we’ll take it from there. Bring a polaroid camera and a diary. Okay? Off OLIVER'S LOOK we CUT TO:  37 SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 22.
OLIVER walks, carrying his bag. Note we need a place that’s different to the bridge for another stretch of walking. He is extremely uncertain. JORDANA is there waiting, smoking a cigarette.
She looked good except for a small patch of dry skin between her index and middle fingers. Most likely caused by her dog. I chose not to mention it.
Have you got the camera and diary? OLIVER gets his camera from his bag and shows a brand new diary.
Do you have the pamphlet?
Give me the camera. Tentatively, OLIVER approaches. He hands her the camera.

Okay. Now, kneel down. OLIVER does so. JORDANA leans down into a kissing position. OLIVER, TENTATIVELY, KISSES her. He closes his eyes. We hear a camera flash and the whirr of the motor. Startled, Oliver looks to the camera. Polaroids spit out onto the floor. OLIVER looks at a patch of ECZEMA on JORDANA’S NECK.
We kissed until our lips felt swollen. Her mouth tasted of milk and polo mints.
Okay- take out the diary. Turn to today’s date and write a few paragraphs on how excited you were to have got off with me. Make sure you say what a dick Mark Pritchard is and slag off Abby Sluts.
It’s Smuts.  SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 22A.
Let’s call her Sluts.  SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 23.
I sit next to her in geography so I am going to exercise restraint.
I don’t need your life story. OLIVER sits down and starts to write. JORDANA looks throu the photos.
Wow. You look mentally retarded. We see various images.
Have you ever kissed anyone before?

I had in fact only kissed one person before: Zoe Preece. It was after the Cowboys and Indian school disco. I told her if we were going to do it we had to hide behind the refectory. Her tongue was blue from blackcurrent squash. It smoldered in the cold. We see this as a cut-away scene. They are dressed as a Co and Indian.
Okay. I’ve done it. JORDANA looks at it over OLIVER’S shoulder. OLIVER doesn’ know how to respond to her being so near to him.
Good.
Can I have the pamphlet now?

(from the floor, half to himself) Don’t you ever come back you fucking mystic.
Oliver. This is not acceptable. We see JILL appear at the window. We see Graham’s POV of JILL. He looks away.  145 SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 87. (CONT'D)

Knock. Knock.

How are you feeling?

Yes.

Why would I be angry with Jordana? Oh you mean me. Yes. I am. I’m upset. Go to sleep now, Ol. We’re not going to punish you now, but your mother and I are going to talk about what you’ve done.
Maybe you should talk about what you've done.

I’m hiding it.
You're sweet.
Your hair was better when it was longer.
OLIVER picks up a padded envelope addressed to him.
He opens it. JORDANA’S CLIPPER, some matches, the books OLIVER bought her and a letter fall out. NOTE we film JORDANA reading this out. We do this against black in the studio.

Dear Oliver, I tried to tell you but I figure you'll probably only believe me if it’s in writing. It’s over. I enclose my Clipper as a parting gift for you. Also, I think you should know I’ve found someone else. (MORE)

PS you were right about my being allergic to dogs. I got tested. Oh, and in case you’re interested, my mum’s fine now. Sorry if it made you feel awkward. In each location I lay a single red rose. When I’m depressed I tend towards symbolism. I’ve already turned these moments into the super 8 footage of memory. We see Oliver lay the first rose in a certain place. We A cut to all these places - empty, devoid of people. There is a single red rose in each one. We film these normally and on super 8. - a girl with the exact same frame and the exact same hair - and when she turns around I see that her face is nothing like Jordana’s and she asks if she knows me and I look traumatized and say, ‘No, I’m sorry, no, you don’t know me, nobody knows me.’  SUBMARINE 23rd NOVEMBER 2009 RED 92A.

I will remain a victim forever, like Zoe, who is probably, right at this moment, wallowing in her own sorrowful existence, unable to move her massive bulk as bunions grow in the folds of her voluminous skin.
